description:
If an expired vnc token is used, I'd expect an appropriate HTTP response. However, currently novnc just hangs at "Starting VNC handshake".

To reproduce

1. nova get-vnc-console <uuid> novnc => returns a URI with the token
2. point browser to the returned URI after the expiry
3. page hangs at "Starting VNC handshake"

Expected response

An appropriate HTTP response
title: Expired vnc token doesn't fail fast

comments.content:
If an expired vnc token is used, I'd expect an HTTP 401. However, currently novnc just hangs at "Starting VNC handshake".

To reproduce

1. nova get-vnc-console <uuid> novnc => returns a URI with the token
2. point browser to the returned URI after the expiry
3. page hangs at "Starting VNC handshake"

Expected response

HTTP 401
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~parthipan

comments.content: Actually it's related with noVNC. There is no way to return 401.
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~sahid-ferdjaoui
